text.headline: Fact: The principal mechanism of COVID-19 infection is aerosol
text.text: See the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) mega document: https://tinyurl.com/FAQ-aerosols

text.headline: A/C in Guangzhou Restaurant
text.text: Study: COVID-19 Outbreak Associated with Air Conditioning in Restaurant, Guangzhou, China, 2020

media.caption: Several passengers became infected during the four-hour bus journey.

text.headline: 'Twice as far'
text.text: Coronavirus can travel twice as far as official ‘safe distance’ and stay in air for 30 minutes, Chinese study finds

media.caption: Schlieren Imaging with high speed sensitivity camera recording (10,000 frames/second, courtesy of Bell Labs)

text.headline: This is how we sneeze
text.text: High-speed Video showing a human sneeze

text.headline: How there is there any debate?
text.text: Social media post on Reddit, 'the front page of the internet'

text.headline: People at choir practice infected at distance
text.text: Following a 2.5-hour choir practice attended by 61 persons, including a symptomatic index patient, 32 confirmed and 20 probable secondary COVID-19 cases occurred (attack rate = 53.3% to 86.7%); three patients were hospitalized, and two died. Transmission was likely facilitated by close proximity (within 6 feet) during practice and augmented by the act of singing. Study available much later in September.

media.caption: Laser-induced fluorescence is a method of using lasers to cause specific substances to emit light
media.credit: By Jan Pavelka/Wikimedia Commons, CC BY-SA

text.headline: Growing body of research
text.text: A growing body of research shows that SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, can spread from person to person through the air. Indoor spaces with poor ventilation in areas where the virus is prevalent are particularly hazardous

media.caption: Snapshots of the droplet-laden cough simulation
media.credit: University of Twente and University of Rome Tor Vergata

text.headline: Airborne transmission
text.text: Study: Long-distance airborne transmission through multiphase turbulent droplet cloud emission is an essential factor

text.headline: 56 infected in a Starbucks in South Korea
text.text: 56 coronavirus cases were linked to a Starbucks in South Korea. But employees who were wearing masks didn't get infected. TODO: Link/pic & date to be changed to be replaced with those of actual study.

media.caption: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Dr. Robert Redfield puts his mask back on after speaking at a Senate Appropriations subcommittee hearing

text.headline: CDC changes, then retracts, web posting on how virus spreads
text.text:
The top U.S. public health agency stirred confusion by posting — and then taking down — an apparent change in its position on how easily the coronavirus can spread from person to person through the air.
But officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention say their position has not really changed ...
